titleInfo.title: LSU History Oral History Project: Athletics at LSU
titleInfo.subTitle: Joe Dean oral history interview, 1995, 1997.

name.description: Joe Dean played basketball for LSU between 1948 and 1952, spent almost 20 years as a nationally-known television color analyst for SEC basketball, and was LSU Athletic Director between 1987 and 2001.

subject.topic: Louisiana State University and Agricultural and Mechanical College--Basketball.
Louisiana State University (Baton Rouge, La.).--Athletic Dept.

mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries Special Collections (http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special)
mods.accessCondition: Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright is retained by the interviewer and heirs and Louisiana State University in accordance with U.S. copyright laws.

"E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments. See instructions for ordering reprints of this audio here: http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special/services/duplication.html Mention the ""Item number"" or ""Item URL"" in your request. "
mods.abstract: Dean discusses playing high school basketball in Indiana, the social life of students at Louisiana State University, playing basketball at LSU and its reception by the students, playing for the Phillips 66 Oilers of the National Industrial Basketball League, his work for Converse and as a television color analyst for SEC basketball, and his time as LSU athletic director.
